name: Tribute to Sam and Diane Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What book does Sam read in an effort to impress Diane (and Sumner)?
questions.explanation:
'War and Peace'.

	'You mean there's a movie!'

questions.text: Which actress did NOT play a woman with whom Sam had a date or a romance?
questions.explanation:
Allyce Beasley.

	Beasley (of 'Moonlighting' fame) played Coach's daughter in one episode. Mulgrew played a politician with whom Sam got involved. Corbett ('Rockford Files') played a blind date for Sam that Diane arranged. Feldon played a girl friend that Sam saw on a once-a-year basis (a la 'Same Time, Next Year').

questions.text: Diane calls out Sam's name at a most inopportune time. When?
questions.explanation:
While she's with Frasier.

	'Oh, come on, Diane ... there's no reason to kill ME.'

questions.text: Diane is upset with Sam because the blind date that he arranges for her is a what?
questions.explanation:
A murderer.

	'That place is bad luck for me. I killed a waitress there.'

questions.text: What good luck charm belonging to Sam gets lost?
questions.explanation:
Bottle cap.

	Lost by a relief pitcher.

questions.text: When Diane is looking for a sign (in a convent) as to what she should do, Sam re-appears in a 'timely' manner. Why?
questions.correct: He's looking for the men's room
options: He wants to date a nun
questions.explanation:
He's looking for the men's room.

	'It's not the parting of the Red Sea ... but that's nitpicking.'

questions.text: What song does Cliff sing to Diane in an attempt to get her aroused?
Diane mistakenly believes that Sam is what?
questions.correct: The father of one of Carla's kids
options: The father of Frasier and Lilith's son
questions.explanation:
The father of one of Carla's kids.

	Never drink an 'open grave'.

questions.text: Diane helps an aspiring actor by doing a scene with him from what play?
questions.explanation:
'Othello'.

	'I love it! A Desdemona that fights back!'

questions.text: Which of the following did NOT appear as an actor on the show?
questions.explanation:
Garry Portnoy.

	Anderson played a slick con man (prior to his 'Night Court' days). Perlman, Rhea's father, played a regular at the Bar. (Heide Perlman, another member of the family, worked creatively behind the scenes.) Swanson played Woody's girlfriend, Kelly. Portnoy may not have appeared on the show -but he did a great job singing the theme song.
